title.native: ヴァニタスの手記 2クール
title.english: The Case Study of Vanitas Part 2

description:
The second cour of Vanitas no Carte.

It’s 19th-century Paris, and young vampire Noé hunts for the Book of Vanitas. Attacked by a vampire driven insane, a human doctor called Vanitas tempts Noé with a mad crusade to “cure” the entire vampire race. While allying with him may be dangerous, news reaches Vanitas that the Beast of Gévaudan has returned, and Noé is being brought along to investigate this phantom from the past.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: บันทึกแวมไพร์วานิทัส พาร์ท 2

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Steampunk
tags.description: Prominently features technology and designs inspired by 19th-century industrial steam-powered machinery.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

node.description:
[Official Website](https://www.littlegleemonster.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LittleGleeMonst) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/LittleGleeMonster) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/littlegleemonster_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/LittleGleeMonsterYT)

__Current members:__
• __芹奈__ - Serina Hasegawa (長谷川芹奈) born June 1, 1998.
• __アサヒ__ - Asahi Kobayashi (小林あさひ) born May 13, 1999.
• __MAYU__ - Mayu Yoshida (吉田真悠) born September 12, 1999.
• __かれん__ - Karen Koga (古賀かれん) born June 8, 1998.
• __manaka__ - Manaka Fukumoto (福本まなか) born December 5, 2000.

__Former members:__
• __YUKA__ - Yuka Sakamoto (坂本有香) born April 20, 1999, graduated October 2013.
• __LINA__ - Lina Yoshimura (吉村リナ)born June 24, 1999, graduated July 2013.
• __麻珠__ - Maju Arai (荒井麻珠)born April 25, 1998, graduated on June 30, 2017.

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/jonasfalcao82/)

Jonas Falcão is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director and singer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jun_mdesu)

A Japanese manga artist who began her professional career as a student. She is best known for the manga series _Pandora Hearts_ which ran in GFantasy from 2006 to 2015. She is also the author of the one-shot manga _Crimson-Shell_, running manga series _The Case Study of Vanitas (Vanitas no Carte)_, and illustrator of the _Boukyaku no Haou Roland_ and _Caucus Race_ novels.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/南雅彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masahiko_Minami)

A founder and representative director of studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/). Also the leading producer of its Studio B.

After graduating from Osaka University of Arts, Minami joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) in 1984. There he did desk work and served as a production assistant on many of [Masuo Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/148840/)'s productions. He was promoted to producer on [Musha Knight Commando](https://anilist.co/anime/9087/) in 1991, and from there he went on to produce shows such as [Mobile Fighter G Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/96/), [Vision of Escaflowne](https://anilist.co/anime/182/) and [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/). In 1998, he left Sunrise and established Bones with [Toshihiro Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/103531/) and the late [Hiroshi Ousaka](https://anilist.co/staff/107410/). He was elected as the representative director of the studio and has held the position since.

Minami's classmates at university included [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/), [Hiroyuki Yamaga](https://anilist.co/staff/100988/), and [Kazuhiko Shimamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/97479/). He appears as a character in the manga [Aoi Honoo](https://anilist.co/manga/55292/), which Shimamoto wrote about his own university days. The manga also received a TV drama adaptation, in which Minami was portrayed by actor Kaname Endou.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.
Leading producer of Studio A at [bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshi_u)

Originating from [Tezuka Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/200/). Currently freelance, but often works for [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

Notable works as a character designer include [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/), [Soul Eater](https://anilist.co/anime/3588/) and [Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshi_u)

Originating from [Tezuka Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/200/). Currently freelance, but often works for [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

Notable works as a character designer include [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/), [Soul Eater](https://anilist.co/anime/3588/) and [Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/).

**[SOUND BOX Profile (JP)](http://www.sound-box.jp/information/shizuo_k.html)** | **[SOUND BOX Profile (EN)](http://www.sound-box.jp/english/information/shizuo_k.html)**

Shizuo Kurahashi is a Japanese sound effects editor. He worked as an editor at the Nikkatsu filming studio. After that he started his sound career in ToyoOnkyo. 

He established his own company SOUND BOX in 1988. Since 1983, when the dolby stereo system got popular in Japan - he has been creating filmsounds. He has edited and arranged sounds for over 1000 works.
Representative director of [Contents Seed](https://anilist.co/studio/6863/), a company specializing in character goods.
